text: Greta Morrison (11 July 1944 - 7 August 2018) was a Canadian model who was successful in Britain during the 1970s and later co-founded a polo club. She has been seen as one of the fuller-figured successors to the skinny models of London's Swinging Sixties such as Twiggy and Jean Shrimpton and featured regularly in the innovative Nova magazine.Greta Morrison obituary. The Times, 1 September 2018. Retrieved 8 September 2018. Greta Morrison Memorial Service. Polo Times Magazine, 20 August 2018. Retrieved 8 September 2018. She was once chosen as the body-double for Brigitte Bardot. She married the photographer Tony Norris, and later Bryan Morrison, the manager of Pink Floyd. After Morrison's death in 2008 she married James Scott, professor of medicine at Imperial College, London. With Morrison and Norman Lobel she founded the Royal County of Berkshire Polo Club in 1985 which she managed after Morrison's death. == References == Category:1944 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Canadian emigrants to the United Kingdom Category:Canadian female models Category:Models from Montreal
title: Greta Morrison
